24901866.trustfund:
TF011087-Tanzania-Ethiopia: Learning
            best practice in establishing commodity exc

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Financial Sector Support
            Project (FSP) for Tanzania were as follows: outcomes were
            moderately satisfactory; risk to development outcome was
            negligible; Bank performance was moderately satisfactory and
            borrower performance was satisfactory. Some lessons learned
            includes: project design needs to be more realistic in terms
            of the range of activities and how they are implemented.
            Teams need to better appreciate the importance of getting
            the results framework right at the outset. This means
            ensuring that the objectives accurately reflect the project
            activities and the real intent of the project-in this case,
            laying the foundation through legal, regulatory, and
            institutional reforms and capacity building. Despite its
            complexity and ambitious time frame, FSP is a good example
            of a high-risk, high-reward operation in a sector where
            reforms are difficult and take time. Notwithstanding the
            goal of mainstreaming, project management should be
            structured to make sure that the incentives are in place for
            implementing agency staff to give sufficient attention to
            project implementation. Given the implicit capacity building
            objective of this type of project, south-south learning
            exchange is highly valuable.

repnme.cdata!:
Tanzania - Financial Sector Support Project
            : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Financial Sector
            Support Project for Tanzania is to promote increased
            household and firm access to financial services, facilitate
            efficient financial intermediation, and support financial
            stability and integrity. The changes include: the targets
            for the indicator interest rate spread will be revised to
            better align them to the baseline data. Interest rate
            spreads the difference between the lending and the deposit
            rates, measure the efficiency of financial intermediation.
            In the absence of baseline date at the time of project
            design the current results framework puts the target for
            interest rate spreads higher than the actual baseline
            figure. The revision of the targets will take into account
            the information on the baseline data.

display_title.display_title:
Tanzania - Financial Sector
            Support Project : restructuring (Vol. 2) : Data sheet

repnme.cdata!:
Tanzania - Financial Sector Support Project
            : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The Financial Sector Support (FSP)
            Project for Tanzania aims to increase the soundness and
            competitiveness of the financial sector and improve access
            by small savers and micro entrepreneurs to the formal
            financial system. The closing date for the project will be
            extended from July 31, 2011 until January 31, 2013. The
            extension of FSP is critical because the project provides a
            comprehensive coverage of the financial sector in Tanzania
            and supports most of the activities recommended by the
            Financial Sector Assessment Program (FSAP) update (September
            2010) under the government's financial sector
            framework. If no extension is made, a grace period of more
            than 18 months will be needed for some of the ongoing
            contracts whose expiry period extends up to 18 months
            according to the World Bank requirements. The extension of
            closing date is therefore critical to achieve the project
            development objective (PDO) and ensure its sustainability.
            This will be the first extension of the project.

display_title.display_title:
Tanzania - Financial Sector
            Support Project : restructuring  (Vol. 2) : Data sheet
